pageContext.description:
The sheet is the cover page of the second volume of the Lutheran bible that belonged to Prince Georg III of Anhalt, a three volume edition printed in 1541 on parchment [Georg 1476.2°]. An illustration of 'Law and Grace' was also represented in the third volume. The present image depicts Melanchthon as a half-length figure, facing left against a bright blue background. Melanchthon is wearing the typical black gown. The image is framed by a blue boarder containing the nine coats-of-arms of Anhalt as well as Melanchthon's own coat-of-arms, which is located beneath the image. 
[Görres, cda 2016]

metadata.title: Portrait of Philipp Melanchthon [from the bible of Georg III. of Anhalt, Georg 1476.2°, vol. 2, cover sheet of titel, recto]

pageContext.relatedWorks:
Lost illustrations from the bible: 
- a full page minature depicting the Anhalt coat-of-arms (formerly in the second volume), illustrated in Wahl 1935, fig. 2
- a portrait of Luther (formerly in the first volume), mentioned by Boës 1928, pp. 9-10.
[Görres, cda 2016]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- slightly abraded on golden frame bottom right
- stained blue colour in top area of coat-of-arm framing
[Anhaltische Landesbücherei Dessau, revised 2016]

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia at the bottom right: serpent with dropped wings, facing left, in gold und date '1544'
[cda 2016]
